p: According to He et al., alveolar macrophages are crucial for the induction of ADCP by human and mouse monoclonal antibodies both in vitro and in experiments on protecting animals from infection with homologous and heterologous influenza A virus strains [ 37]. Interestingly, the ability of alveolar macrophages to protect the lungs from damage during an influenza infection is reduced in elderly mice [ 38].
